artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sanoya Tomigorō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 200.3; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 63, p. 297.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: demon at right with long dark hair, peering around an oval element with red decorative flames around it on a black stand at left; man at center dressed in predominately blue, rust red and green, leaning his head forward toward demon, holding his sword in its sheath at his PL side; two fallen figures, covering their heads, at right; blowing fall leaves throughout
dimension: 14 7/16 × 9 1/2 in. (36.67 × 24.13 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: R, C: 魁斎 {Kaisai}, L: 月岡 {Tsukioka} | Carver’s seal R: ？？刀 [unread] | Censor seal: 辰正改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Eight Views of Tales of Warriors (Bidan musha hakkei 美談武者八景
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Clearing Weather of the Togakushi Mountains (Togakushi no seiran 戸隠の晴嵐　平惟茂朝臣): Taira no Koremori Ason
